intro: Hieracium ingolfii, commonly known as Ingolf's hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, showing some adaptability to different environments. Its flowers are composed of both ray and disk florets, typical of the daisy family. Hieracium ingolfii is often found in mountainous regions and is considered a species of conservation concern in some areas.
